statement.tex: %text Find the equation of the plane passing through the point $(-1,3,2)$ and perpendicular to each of the planes $x+2y+3z=5$ and $3x+3y+z=0$. %

reason.tex: %text If two planes having direction rations $(a_1,b_1,c_1)$ and $(a_2,b_2,c_2)$ are $\perp$, the normals to the planes are also $\perp$ and their direction ratios bear the relationship, % \begin{align} a_1a_2+b_1b_2+c_1c_2=0 \end{align}\\

options.tex: %text Since $(-1,3,2)$ lies on the plane $ax+by+cz+d=0$, it must satisfy the equation of the plane, % \begin{align} \therefore -a+3b+2c+d=0 \end{align}\\

reason.tex: %text It is trivially true that any point satisfying the equation of a geometric function must satisfy the said equation. Therefore since $(-1,3,2)$ lies on the plane $ax+by+cz+d=0$, % \begin{align} -a+3b+2c+d=0 \end{align}\\

options.tex: %text So far we have gathered the following equations. % \begin{align} &a+2b+3c=0 \\ &3a+3b+c=0 \\ &a-3b-2c-d=0 \end{align} \\ %text Given the above equations, working out the relative values of $a$, $b$, $c$ and $d$, we get the resulting equation for the plane represented by $ax+by+cz+d=0$ as, % \begin{align} 7x-8y+3z+25=0 \end{align}

%text So far we have gathered the following equations. % \begin{align} &a+2b+3c=0 \\ &3a+3b+c=0 \\ &a-3b-2c-d=0 \end{align} \\ %text Given the above equations, working out the individual values of $a$, $b$, $c$ and $d$ is not possible, therefore we cannot get the equation for the plane represented by $ax+by+cz+d=0$. %

reason.tex: \begin{align} a+2b+3c=0 &\quad (1) \\ 3a+3b+c=0 &\quad (2) \\ a-3b-2c-d=0 &\quad (3) \end{align} \\ %text Using $(1)$ and $(2)$ to get $a$, $b$ in terms of $c$ we get, % \begin{align} a=\dfrac{7c}{3}, b=-\dfrac{8c}{3}& \quad (4) \end{align}\\ %text Substituting results from $(4)$ into $(3)$, we get, % \begin{align} &\dfrac{7c}{3}-3\left(-\dfrac{8c}{3}\right)-2c-d=0 \\ \implies &7c+24c-6c=d \implies d=\dfrac{25c}{3}\quad (5) \end{align} \\ %text Using results $(4)$ and $(5)$ and substituting the values of $a$, $b$ and $d$ into $ax+by+cz+d=0$ (equation of the plane) we get, % \begin{align} &\dfrac{7c}{3}x-\dfrac{8c}{3}y+cz+\dfrac{25c}{3}=0 \\ \implies &7x-8y+3z+25=0 \end{align}
